Ensuite, j'ai choisi un poisson, qui était bien bon aussi. Et pour dessert, une mousse au chocolat noir, légère et crémeuse, suivie d'une tisane.   Une bonne expérience dans l'ensemble. Bon endroit pour célébrer une fête ou pour impressionner l'élu(e) de votre coeur!

Of course this place is elegant and classy, and as one would expect, not inexpensive. We went for a large family breakfast and were seated in a private alcove as all the window seats were taken. Though the buffet and menu options were limited, the kitchen quite willingly accommodated our special requests.     The buffet option didn't seem worth it as the offerings were only fruit and sundries. We ordered a la carte and were pleased with our meal, though not blown away. The service was nothing short of the Ritz standard. The most stand out was the COFFE (I must have had at least 10 refills) and the French toast.

Who would have thought that food served in a hotel restaurant could be 'I still salivate as I dream about it' worthy? Well I guess if you're the Ritz Carlton you wouldn't settle for a restaurant that didn't make Canada's top 100 list. Let alone, anything below the nb 27th spot held by La Maison Boulud!  Namesake restaurant after Michelin star renowned chef Daniel Boulud, this place is probably the epitome of fine dining in Montreal... well at least from my experiences ;)  Every dish is a work of art in not only presentation but in complexity of flavour. There is not a single drop of sauce that goes unnoticed for the depth of flavour it adds to the dish as a whole. That little dot of brown sauce in the lobster bisque? It's actually a reduction of mushrooms that adds an earthy element to a seafood flavoured dish. That hint of yellow you get underneath the parmesan emulsion? Yes, there is indeed lemon zest that freshens everything up.  From the moment you walk in and get seated by the stunning model like hostess to the one where the waiter expertly recommends and paces your food to finally the one where you let that perfectly creamy burrata melt in your mouth ... you'll really feel like you've just experienced what Montreal and the historically luxurious Ritz had to offer in terms of the finer things in life.  Granted, with finer things do come along a more pricier tag, but from time to time it's worth the splurge and La Maison Boulud falls into that category :)

Excellent food, top notch service.  Iberico jambon, guinea hen, fresh white Italian truffles which can be added to any dish you like.  Its truffle season so it made sense to throw some on the hen.  They also had a top shelf wine selection especially French wines.  Again, the service-- just extremely considerate, attentive and professional.

Since Daniel Boulud has his name on this restaurant, and it is located in the most expensive hotel in Montreal, you are not going to go wrong.  My friend and I had a great meal here.  It's not at all a stuffy, formal dining room, though it does possess about the most gorgeous, beautiful bar I have ever seen in any restaurant, anywhere.  I was all set to wear a suit and tie, but when I saw what my companion decided to wear and when I looked at the pictures of the space, I decided on just a nice shirt and slacks.  That was a good choice.  Most of the diners were dressed on the more casual side.  But, the food we had would have been right at home at the very formal Daniel in New York.  Our meal was simply exquisite.  Unknowingly ahead of time, my companion and I ordered the same courses: crudo de dorade, ravioli with sweet potato and primo sale cheese, and halibut.  Halibut is my favorite fish, and this is the best halibut course I've ever had in my life.  We finished with a blood orange dessert that had both of our mouths dropping to the floor.  It was the standout course in a meal of standouts.  Bread service was great.  Wine service was even greater, with a delightful sommelier who put up with my friend's somewhat finicky palate.  And we had negronis that were knockouts.  This place is not cheap, but it's worth every penny--if you want to indulge, this is the place to do it.  (Did I mention that the wines by the glass were spectacular?)  I absolutely loved this restaurant and our evening was made even more special by the wedding that was taking place in the garden, visible through the windows behind our seats.  I may not be able to afford a stay at the Ritz Carlton on my next visit, but at least I can eat here!  It really is a great place.

The hard product here is fine, the food is good enough and the atmosphere is very nice (especially the outside dining area in the back). What I found lacking was the service, which felt very cold and sterile. The food itself was not particularly memorable but was satisfactory if going for a casual business lunch.  Overall it was a very average dining experience and I feel would be best suited for a meal only if your in the area and out of options.

Hi! I am from Montreal, a total foodie and love to frequent the city's best restaurants. I booked Boulud for my partner and I's anniversary last Saturday evening. It was my third time frequenting Boulud. In the past I had very lovely dining experiences here.   This experience, however, left me completely perplexed and underwhelmed by the quality of service and ambiance.   First off, we were seated on their terrasse area - however because it is autumn, it was cold. We were seated in a corner, which was surrounded by a white nylon tarp/tent and awful bright LED strip lighting. This was very underwhelming setting for a restaurant of this caliber. It felt like high end food served in a hotel lobby, quite touristy.   Next was the service, which was questionable. The wait staff was snappy, rude and inconsistent. Not helpful.   The food was good but due to the overall vibe, we already had a bad taste in our mouths. It felt and looked like a cheap hotel lobby restaurant.   Good food does not justify poor ambiance and bad staff. I really wish I had a better experience this time!   There are MANY excellent restaurants in Montreal and for the quality of experience I received, I would unfortunately not return back to Boulud.

Ambience was great, classy, elegant and feels rich.  Service was professional and top notch from the reception to the server.  Not too intimidating, very knowledgable and professional overall.  Food was not  French as expected, a notable Italian dishes were found on the menu given Chef Daniel Boulud concept is more towards classic French. However the taste for all dishes were great, well executed. Food presentation was classic, simple, nice and precise.  Price wise it was on the expensive side, be ready to spend about $150 per person. It was worth it especially  for a special occasion.  This was my second visit and it did not disappoint for sure.
Good food, nice place, we went on a Saturday and it was brunch, 2 or 3 plates to choose but they were nice and let us order only one plate for each of my kids since 2 plates would've been too much.

Just finished a fabulous brunch today on a beautiful Sunday afternoon in Montreal. The reservation was for 130pm and the atmosphere was spectacular. Located right next to the Ritz Carlton hotel, the 2 of us were nestled in our own oasis with a pond and beautiful scenery (please see pic).   Brunch is 39 dollars for 2 courses (app and main or main and dessert) or 49 for 3 courses. We went for 2 courses. To start we both had the baby beet salad, ruban blue fresh goat cheese, pistachios and watercress. Wow...what a salad. So fresh and each mouthful was heaven. Next up, I had the Louis d'Or stuffed agnolotti pasta, tarragon sweet peas and green asparagus. The pasta is housemade and again, wow...I didn't want it to end. My friend ordered the housemade smoked salmon and sunny side egg, potato latke, creme fraiche, red onions and capers. She seemed to really enjoy it!   Great service, great food and amazing atmosphere. Worth checking out and make a reservation so that you can sit outside!

I had a great time at this Boloud!  The ambiance is refined yet friendly.I wasn't entirely sure about the idea of eating by myself smack dab in the middle of the restaurant, so the staff ushered me to their private room with a view of the kitchen. It was great!  I ordered the  three course, late night supper menu. The complimentary arancini in squid ink was quite alright: tiny bite sized morsels to whet one's appetite. While the poricini soup was very seasonal, it looked unfortunately, but understandably, muddy brown. I quite enjoyed its earthy yet delicate flavors. I really enjoyed the lamb main course: succulent and tender and paired really well with refreshing, grilled vegetables. I rounded off my meal with a palette enriching cheese plate.  The glasses of Chianti I ordered complimented the meal very well.  I will admit that different servers bringing different courses felt a bit unnecessary. However, all of them were very polite and engaged me in friendly conversation. At the end of the evening, I was satiated and in a good spirits. I'll be back!

High end restaurant at the Ritz Carlton. Chef is doing a good job with the menu but definitely you can tell that it's not Chef Boulud 100%. Service, ambient taste were good. Pricey but given the fact that has the two big words Boulud and Ritz, it was expected. I enjoyed the dinner but we were expecting more. Still being a great restaurant but among the label of " Best chef/ restaurant in Montreal" it's not a personal favorite.

We came here for our anniversary, and ordered the degustation (tasting menu). However, as I was craving a nice foie gras with my dinner which was not part of my degustation, they were kind enough to make up a plate to accommodate us. Every plate we received was different. Thus instead of having 6 dishes, we were able to have 12 to share. Our experience was wonderful, and we look forward to our return. Exceptional food & service.

Brunch at Boulud is the way every week-end should start. Perfect garden terrace, delicious food and incredible service. The Brunch formula is 39$ for a 2-course and 49$ for 3. Fancy brunch, yes. But Oh so worth it.  Try the classic Vitello Tonnato to start - it's perfect!  I will definitely go back.. over and over again!

The dining experience at Maison Boulud is very good, but not five stars as expected given the lineage and the price.  Service was perfect and the ambience was very nice.  But wine list was obnoxiously expensive with even a modest bottle running almost $200.  Fried artichokes were really good with a tasty aioli sauce.  Seafood appetizers were good, but not distinctive.  And the Cote de Beouf, while flavorful (60 day aged) was a bit undercooked and more fatty than expected.  It was a very good and enjoyable meal, but with $25+ appetizers and $50+ entrees, it should be one step more.

This was our bougie dinner choice of our trip to Montreal and it was also my first time doing a tasting menu! Maison Boulud, from Chef Daniel Boulud, really made a lasting impression on me. We had an 8pm reservation, and were seated out on the patio overlooking the pond area - really cute!  The tasting menu is 6 courses, and the chef takes in any dietary restrictions/dislikes and sends out the courses. There is no set menu. We came in pretty hungry, and I did worry that we might leave hungry - but we left so stuffed! Some of my favorite dishes was the handmade gnocchi with lobster, the arancini amuse bouche, and the tuna tataki with clams. We also had several desserts - chocolate souffle was delicious and so was the passionfruit tartlets!  Service was truly excellent. Our meal took about 3 hours so you definitely just sit and eat and get full to the max. We couldn't even finish our desserts! Beautiful hotel and space, would definitely recommend!

Very nice place, I brought my wife here for our anniversary and was not disappointing.  The sommelier was fantastic offering great wine pairings, the waiter took great care of us and the food was delicious.    I'd really like to go back during the summer as they have a nice open area in back with a man made pond.. I highly recommend going here.
Really woeful service. Great pea soup and scallops. Unimaginative cheese plate. Generally good, but nowhere near worth the price.

This restaurant is so fancy! I love the fire place and the outdoor covered and heated section. The service is amazing!   My boyfriend and I started with a glass of bubbly each. At first I wanted a glass of rosé bubbly so they opened a magnum bottle for just one glass!!  That's nuts! So I tasted mine and tried the bubbly that my boyfriend picked and I preferred his. The waitress could tell and she said she could take the rosé bubbly back. I was hesitant but the waitress said that it was no problem so I changed it for regular champagne instead. I felt so bad but she  didn't seem to mind.   Then the sommelier helped us pick a good red wine that we ended up liking a lot that was in our budget. He seemed to really know his stuff. We got the Barra (Cabernet Sauvignon).  The waitress gave us these two small cheese bread rolls. They tasted like ritz crackers but in a bread format. They also gave us olive bread and cut baguette. We shared the lobster gnocchi to start. It could also be a main. This was the highlight of the night. That sauce was finger licking good! I was taking the olive bread and dipping it in what was left of the sauce.   For mains we shared the beef duo and the lamb. Both were delicious but I think next time I would get the pasta because that lobster gnocchi really blew  my mind. The beef duo consisted of two rectangular pieces of steak and one square roast beef. Out of the two types of beef I preferred the roast beef. The lamb was very tasty. It came with eggplant, kale and mushrooms.   The dessert was absolutely delicious! We got the chocolate coulant with salted caramel ice cream. As an extra they gave us these little bite sized desserts and they gave us a small jar of hazelnut chocolate to bring home. I haven't opened it yet but I imagine it's like homemade Nutella.   It's pricey so it's not your everyday restaurant but I definitely recommend it for special events.

Damn... made reservations for 0930, thinking there would brunch served, but it was still breakfast. Brunc only starts at 12pm.   Not exactly cheap at $35, but it's nice and civilised, and you get to choose between sitting "indoors" out in the glass courtyard which was nice and bright.

Went there for the pri fixe menu.  There were positives and negatives for the whole night.  First, we were seated in the solarium which was looked nice, but after being seated, we quickly noticed ants on our table.  After squashing 10 or so, it was clearly evident to the wait staff that we were not happy about the situation.  Dead ants on the table were noticeable and the staff offered no mitigation.  Not up to Ritz Level standards.    On the positive side, one in our party really didn't like the pri fixe menu and the chef made several substitutions of which all were delicious.    Back on the negative side the waiter we had had a very thick accent and we all strained to understand his English.  We eventually got there and this being Montreal there's nothing technically wrong with this, but at the price point and level of restaurant, I expect a waiter with impeccable English, and they could have switched our's out when there were issues and didn't.  I have been to other high end restaurants in Montreal with no issues.   Unfortunately, the foie gras course was inedible to me and others at my table.  Several of us just ate a bite or two.  Now granted I am not a huge foie gras fan, but at this level of restaurant, I don't ever expect to gag at the table, which I did.  I would have also expected the staff to ask me if there was a problem.  Which I didn't get so unfortunate.  Other courses were delivered at the high level service you would expect of this place.  For the price the over experience was sub par.

Petit déjeuner par excellence ! Que ce soit, pour célébrer un anniversaire, une occasion spéciale ou autre, la Maison Boulud du Ritz Carlton est désigné pour ça. J'y ai été pour justement un petit déjeuner pour célébrer l'anniversaire de quelqu'un qui m'est cher et nous avons vraiment bien aimés notre expérience. La salle à manger extérieure donne sur le Jardin du Ritz, y'a des petits canards qui font des allées et venues, mignons,  l'aménagement est spacieux, le mobilier est confortable. Au niveau de la nourriture, mes ufs bénédictines étaient succulents (19$), le café biologique était bon (5$) et le jus d'orange frais pressé aussi (5.50$). La qualité était là. Le service était bien mais sans plus. Le petit déjeuner est servi tous les jours de 7h à 10h30AM. Dans l'ensemble, j'ai bien aimé, le tout en général et je pense que je reviendrai dans le futur pour célébrer des occasions spéciales et aussi pour essayer et déguster leur menu du midi et soir.  5/5 Visité en juin 2015.

The best way I can describe my experience at Maison Boulud is by acknowledging the high quality food but with a struggling atmosphere and service experience.   Being connected to the Ritz Carlton helps with it's curb appeal, but once inside, the decor seems old fashioned. Greeted by a friendly staff, you feel the effort to create the sense of importance and class. The food overall is better than average but for the price point, I've had much more memorable experiences (Scramouche in Toronto, for example).   Unfortunately, we had a couple of minor issues where the staff had offered to send their in house sommelier to explain the residue on the bottom of my wine glass. They never came.  Overall, I'm giving a 3* because, as a high end restaurant, I expected a bit more. I will gladly revisit to give it another go in the future.

Creative, fresh ingredients and freshly designed works of culinary art.  The flavors are derived and cherished from the ingredients not added just by salt, sweet or fat.   The presentation and service is perfect with a great wine and cocktail list.  The Prunes and Peaches desert is a must have, delicate desert.  By the way, the pastry chief is an All Canada first place winner for his creations.  Their tea infusions are terrific.     The interior is elegant but not over done.  The furniture is comfortable, well maintained and the atmosphere is airy and very suitable for a business dinner or a romantic night out.   If you are coupling it get a window seat looking out on to the lovely park that the restaurant circles.  There is a nesting of while geese in the small pond that adds a lovely center piece.     Considering the resto is in the middle of downtown Montreal it is a peaceful place to enjoy a couple of hours of culinary bliss.   I see that the cost rating is $$$$ but realistically you are not spending much more than if you went to Baton Rouge BUT you are receiving a world class meal in a lovely, peaceful paradise.
Was my wedding anniversary and ended up choosing this restaurant. The evening was perfect and the food and service were excellent. Definitely an evening to remember.

Food was great. I felt harassed my entire my meal being here. I'm from America and the workers here treated me and looked at me as if I didn't belong in the restaurant and didn't service me well as I noticed many speaking in French and shaking their heads and pointing at me. Such a great place and atmosphere, food, but, terrible customer service.

We had dinner here with family recently; the food and ambiance were excellent. The dishes were on the saltier side, but we tend to find that is the case  whenever we eat out. After an appetizer and main meal, we were really full, but since the pastry chef had just won an award for best pastry chef, we couldn't leave without trying a few desserts. We had the châtaignes et courges and a poire et sirop d`erable dessert. They were a wonderful way to finish the evening.   Everyone compliments the restaurant for the service, and we definitely had more than five people waiting on us all night, but it really only added to the confusion. We also had a waiter who was so shy we couldn't hear him at all. Whatever he brought us tasted delicious, we just weren't sure what was in it! Overall, it was still a lovely evening and if you have the chance to enjoy a meal at Maison Boulud,  you will surely enjoy it.
Tasting menu with the wine pairing was delicious. The staff was professional and well trained.  Highest quality in the city.

Excellent food, decor and service.  Best of four places we ate at in Montreal. Room is spectacular. Service is excellent.  Three appetizers: tuna carpaccio, peppers and snow crab and other fresh stuff.   Main courses Risotto with Morel mushrooms and truffles. Salmon with uni.
I've been here three times, all for dinner, so I can't speak about breakfast or brunch. The food is a culinary experience, definitely enjoyed going there, and everyone I took there enjoyed it too.

Went there for my birthday, a very elegant scenery, sophisticated setting, would recommend for a romantic date, business meetings or just the highlight monthly night out with friends, place could use a bit more music and lighting though.

This is my 100th review on Yelp, which shows that I`m either dedicated or wasted a lot of time. Mr Moderator, do I get a prize such as a Yelp mug or a medal?! ;)  My wife and I recently celebrated our wedding anniversary at Maison Boulud. At the end of the meal, we both agreed that Maison Boulud is one of, if not the best fine dining restaurant in Montreal. This is grand hotel dining of the highest order.  We had outdoor seating and thoroughly enjoyed the urban garden along with the duck pond (I've had an inexplicable fondness for ducks since I was a child).   We had the tasting menu, which consisted of 2 appetizers, 1 pasta, 1 fish, 1 meat and 2 desserts. My personal favorites were the cured Japanese snapper appetizer, the Wagyu beef tataki, a lamb dish (quality of the meat was unreal)... and the addictive madeleine at the end of the meal.   The service is outstanding, yet not intimidating (as opposed to similar restaurants). The bill was a bit stiff but totally worth it considering the amazing meal we had. Will definitely return on the next special occasion.

I ate at Maison Boulud with my friend for a special occasion. I was totally shock to find a fly in my glass of wine. I told the waiter, and he only replaced it with a new glass and filled back the amount I had left in the glass before. They charged me full price for the wine at the end. Regarding Maison Boulud as a property of Ritz and the prices they've charged, I expect it to be a high-end restaurant, and offer a better service. This is totally unacceptable and disappointed. I will not come back to this restaurant anymore, and will not recommend any of my friends to come here. There are many other high-end restaurants in town that have both good food and good service.
Excellent local French cuisine. Superb beet salad and trout fish. French speaking only.  Regards, Shaq Zaidi, MD

On a testé cette place pour un "Tea Time"... Et on a été très déçu par la qualité de ce qui nous a été servi... Sans parler des quantités. Quand on compare avec le prix payé, ce n'est vraiment pas à la hauteur d'autres places comme Birks (de Europea). Si on compare uniquement les pâtisseries, on est très loin de ce que font Patrice Demers (Chez Patrice) ou encore l'excellent Christian Faure (Maison de Christian Faure). J'ai rarement un avis aussi négatif que ça, mais pour connaître bien des places à Montréal, je vous déconseille celle là pour le rapport qualité/prix.  Pour les amateurs de thé, je ne parle même pas de la liste des choix des thés proposés (je rappelle que c'est aussi un salon de thé)... Peu de choix et certains sont bien ordinaires. Encore une fois, vraiment en dessous de bien d'autres places à Montréal.  Ce que j'écris représente un avis personnel, il est donc possible que d'autres personnes aient vécu une meilleure expérience que moi... Et c'est tant mieux.  Je mets quand même 2 étoiles car c'est une bel endroit, mais comme vous l'aurez compris, ce n'est pas pour le contenu de l'Assiette :)
